Ok teacher brag moment❤️ 2019 All District honor choir is in the books!!!!!!Our morning started very early this morning. The alarm went off at 3:45 AM. 44 Broken Bow Choir kids climbed onto 1 bus and left Broken Bow around 5:15 AM. They have worked with a clinician all day to perfect 4 different songs and took part in a wonderful concert tonight. They made some beautiful music today. The thing that I want to brag on is their behavior. We had kids that represented Broken Bow in a very positive way. Our kids acted like ladies and gentlemen. When you have 44 kids and 2 sponsors you need kids that are going to listen to directions and kids that are going to do what they are supposed to do even when we are not standing there holding their hand. It has now been almost 19 hours and we are leaving with a bus full of exhausted but pleasant choir kids. I call this day a SUCCESS! ❤️I am a very proud teacher.

ATTENTION TO ALL WHO VISIT OUR SCHOOL CAMPUSES

Last Friday (11/01/19), a new law went into effect which allows, in many cases, open or concealed carry of a firearm without a license. This law DID NOT change any statute as it applies to carrying a firearm on school property. Currently, only SWORN PEACE OFFICERS are allowed to carry a firearm on school property. The persons will have clear identification of their status as a peace office visible on their person. This rule/law/statute includes all school property, regardless of the occasion or sponsor.

The only exception allowed applies to concealed permit holders: a firearm may be carried inside a car (non-school owned vehicle) in the parking lot. The firearm must be out of sight at all times. If the vehicle is unattended, said vehicle must be locked.

STUDENTS ARE NEVER ALLOWED TO HAVE FIREARMS OR OTHER WEAPONS ON SCHOOL PROPERTY.

post_text: #itsagreatdaytobeaSavage
shared_text:
Jerren Ellis
October 9, 2019 at 11:40 PM ·

Very, very proud of a group of girls tonight for winning a game against the 1 seed in our regional, Hilldale. A true nail biter that had all the drama you could ask for. The tightest strike zone I’ve ever seen. A late inning over turned call that didn’t go our way. Bases loaded, no outs, up 3-0 and our freshman RF makes a play on a not shallow fly ball and uncorks a seed to cut the girl down at the plate for a double play. A catch and crash into the wall on a ball that I thought was gone. A 2 out 3 run bomb by a freshman. And with 2 outs in the bottom of the 7th and a runner on 1st, a diving play in the outfield to end it.
Carlyssa Crutchfield put on the best defensive performance I’ve seen from a CF in 12 years of coaching, she balled out!
And we only start 1 senior. Super excited for the potential of this group.
Back at it again tomorrow with a state tournament berth on the line!!!!
